page.title: 16ST MICHAELS CHURCH
page.content: The earliest history recorded, of Billington Church began in 1277 with the payment by the vicar of Leighton to the chaplain ministering in the 'chapel'. The church is in a strategic position on the hill where it can clearly be seen, and from the churchyard there are views over several counties. The varying population of Billington has had an effect on the church and today the church does not support a resident vicar. It is served by the clergy from the neighbouring church of Leighton. Services are held on Sunday mornings with an average attendance of twenty people, although, after the disastrous fire at Leighton, evening services were held at Billington and the congregation from Leighton helped to fill the church.
